section.title: Presentations and masks
section.para: Presentations can be used to show the height field in other way than as false colors map of heights. Several presentation methods are implemented, including shading, gradient filters and edge detectors. When you use data with superposed presentation within data processing modules or tools the results will be computed from original data – presentation is thus only visualization mode. Presentations can be computationaly intensive to calculate, therefore they are not automatically updated when the underlying data change.

Masks are used for displaying special areal selections (e. g. grains). Masks can have any shape and within data window can be expressed by any chosen color. Masks can be created by different modules or directly by user using Mask selection tool. It it possible to invert, grow, and shrink masks, or extract them to a separate data window using module functions in Data ProcessMask menu.
